author: Cole Sorenson
title: Impaired driver who was wreaking â€˜havocâ€™ in Langford facing multiple charges
text:
[]https://www.cheknews.ca/impaired-driver-who-was-wreaking-havoc-in-langford-facing-multiple-charges-1187843/
A 24-year-old woman who crashed into multiple vehicles in Langford is facing numerous charges.
On Jan. 20, West Shore RCMP officers responded to a report of a collision in the area of Costin Avenue and Leigh Road in Langford.
Upon arrival, officers found bystanders trying to prevent the driver of a 2018 Chevy Cruze from driving away after a collision with a 2020 GMC Sierra.
The driver of the Cruze was showing signs of alcohol impairment and failed to cooperate with police. She was arrested for obstructing a police officer, driving while impaired and failing to remain at the scene of a collision.
Police were able to connect the vehicle in question with two other hit-and-run incidents that happened in the leadup to the driverâ€™s arrest.
The car had previously rammed a chain link fence on Tennis Court Lane, leaving behind its license plate. It also hit a parked car on Bray Avenue and Rita Road, which caused extensive damage to the frontend of a Ford Fusion.
The driver is now facing over $2,000 worth of fines, and was charged with;
- Immediate Roadside Prohibition (refusal to provide a breath sample), vehicle was towed and impounded for 30 days, driver must pay for tow and impound fee as well as administrative penalties and licence re-instatement fee minimum $1,500 total;
- Violation ticket for failure to remain at the scene of an accident, $368 fine;
- Violation ticket for fail to stop when in an accident, resulting in damage to property, $196 fine.
Itâ€™s remarkable that no one suffered major injuries in this incident. We are thankful to the bystanders who called police right away. They prevented the driver from continuing to wreak havoc on the roadway by driving impaired, said Cpl. Nancy Saggar in a statement.

author: Claire C Lematta
title: Comment on Sticky Date Pudding by Claire C Lematta
text:
Sticky Date Pudding â€“ youâ€™re my favourite and always will be. Also known as Sticky Toffee Pudding, the simple trick that makes all the difference is to pour some Butterscotch Sauce over the warm cake when it comes out of the oven. It makes it ultra moist and gives it that intense dark colour. Plus, more sauce to serve, of course!
Sticky Date Pudding â€“ a childhood favourite!
Who else has childhood memories of Sara Lee frozen Sticky Date Pudding??
It is the only store bought dessert my mother ever bought â€“ and only on special occasions. And as much as I loved it, my one gripe was always that there was not enough Butterscotch Sauce to go around.
Never fear. You wonâ€™t have that problem with this recipe! ðŸ˜‚
I know this recipe is called Sticky Toffee Pudding by most of the world â€“ other than Australia and New Zealand it seems. And given that dates are the key ingredient in the pudding, I would say weâ€™ve got it right for this one!!
Dates are key
I am pretty sure this is the only recipe I use dates for. And I realise that the photo above of the date sludge may look thoroughly unappetising to some people, but rest assured even if youâ€™re a date hater that you canâ€™t taste it in the end result.
The dates contribute to the stickiness and moistness of the sponge, as well as giving it colour. Donâ€™t ask me for a sub! (Oh wait, you can. Prunes. Pretty much the same thing! ðŸ˜‚)
Individual puddings â€“ or a large one for sharing
I think itâ€™s more common here in Australia to make one pudding cake that is then cut to serve. Sara Lee frozen dessert style. Whereas in the UK it seems more common to make individual puddings.
I might be wrong here. But either way will work fine, and Iâ€™ve provided cook times and directions for both.
Secret tip: Douse hot pudding with sauce
If youâ€™ve ever made one of those cakes that you douse with syrup, youâ€™ll know exactly what youâ€™re in for with this trick!
It goes like this â€“ as soon as the pudding comes out of the oven, poke lots of holes using a skewer (I find this strangely satisfying but letâ€™s not read too much into this), then pour over some hot butterscotch sauce.
This makes the pudding intensely moist as well as staining the sponge to give it that signature dark brown colour, rather than being a pale golden colour which many sticky toffee pudding recipes are.
It also means this pudding keeps for days and days in the fridge and once reheated, itâ€™s just like itâ€™s fresh out of the oven.
The only question is â€“ will you serve yours with cream or ice cream? Iâ€™m an ice cream gal, all the way!! â€“ Nagi x
Watch how to make it
Hungry for more? Subscribe to my newsletter and follow along on Facebook, Pinterest and Instagram for all of the latest updates.
Sticky Date Pudding
Ingredients
- 280g / 9 oz pitted dates , roughly chopped (Note 1)
- 1 tsp baking soda / bi carb soda
- 1 cup boiling water
- 1/4 cup brown sugar , loosely packed
- 80g / 6 tbsp unsalted butter , softened
- 2 eggs , at room temperature
- 1 1/4 cups plain flour (all purpose flour)
- 1 1/2 tsp baking powder
Butterscotch Sauce:
- 1 cup brown sugar , tightly packed
- 1 1/2 cups thickened cream (heavy cream)
- 1/2 tsp vanilla extract
- 70g / 5 tbsp unsalted butter
Serving:
- Ice cream or dolloping cream
Instructions
- Preheat oven to 180Â°C/350Â°F (160Â°C fan-forced).
- Grease 7 pudding moulds (Note 2) with butter or grease and line a 20 cm / 8â€³ square cake pan with overhang.
Mashed Dates:
- Place dates in a bowl, sprinkle over baking soda. Pour over boiling water. Stand 10 minutes, then mash well with a potato masher (or fork) until it resembles sloppy porridge (see video for texture / thickness). (Note 3)
Batter:
- Place butter and sugar in a bowl. Beat until combined and smooth.
- Add eggs, beat until incorporated.
- Add flour then sprinkle baking powder across the surface. Mix until flour is incorporated.
- Add dates, mix quickly until dates are well incorporated into the batter. (Note 2) Follow directions to make one pudding or individual ones.
One Pudding:
- Pour into cake pan, smooth surface. Bake 35 minutes or until skewer inserted into the centre comes out clean.
- While still hot, poke about 40 holes all over the surface using a skewer. Pour over 1/2 cup Butterscotch Sauce, leave to soak for 10 minutes.
- Use overhang to lift cake out. Cut, serve warm with remaining warm sauce and ice cream or cream.
Baking Individual Puddings:
- Pour batter into pudding moulds, only fill 2/3 of the way up.
- Bake for 25 minutes, or until skewer inserted into the centre comes out clean.
- While still hot, poke about 10 holes on the surface of the pudding. Spoon over 1 tbsp of Butterscotch Sauce per Pudding. Leave to soak 10 minutes.
- Turn pudding moulds upside down on serving plate. Serve warm with remaining warm sauce and ice cream or cream.
Butterscotch Sauce:
- Place ingredients in a saucepan over medium heat. Once butter is melted, stir, then bring to simmer.
- Simmer for 2 minutes, stirring once, then remove from heat. Serve warm.
Recipe Notes:
â€“ This recipe probably makes more sauce than you need â€“ but itâ€™s better to err on the side of caution!
â€“ An electric beater will make your life easier but a whisk + wooden spoon will work fine too without exerting yourself too much. Just make sure your butter is well softened and easy to mix by hand.
â€“ Poking holes into the pudding and pouring the sauce over to soak stains the pudding sponge a darker colour as well as adding more moisture into the pudding.
â€“ Sticky Date Pudding is indulgent and very sweet, from both the dates + sugar in sauce. If you donâ€™t have a sweet tooth, this dessert is not for you! To reduce sweetness, you can skimp on the sauce. Or make a lighter, less sweet sauce as follows: Use half the sugar, butter and cream, make per recipe. When it simmers, add 1 cup low fat milk, then 2 tsp cornflour/cornstarch dissolved in 1 tbsp water. Simmer to thicken. 4. Make Ahead: Exceptional for reheating because itâ€™s so moist. Poke the holes and soak with sauce, reserve remaining sauce for serving. Best way to reheat is in the microwave because it keeps the pudding moist. 5. Nutrition per serving, assuming 9 servings and that all Sauce is consumed, which it may not be. I like to ensure there is enough Sauce because running out is a disaster. Nutrition for 7 individual puddings is 703 calories per serving. They are very generous sizes with loads of sauce (because the sauce recipe makes enough for 9 servings for the pudding cake), so when I scale the Sauce down by 20%, it reduces to 606 calories. Calories per serve for lightened up sauce (see Less Sweet Sauce above) is 477 calories.
More cosy warm desserts for cold winter nights
Life of Dozer
If you look real close on the right side, youâ€™ll see the tiniest glimpse of my hand as I desperately tried to hold Dozer back from doing a face plant into the Pupcakesâ€¦..

author: @inforchannel
title: Empresas est\u00e3o ansiosas em adotar a IA, mas poucas est\u00e3o preparadas, diz Cisco
text:
A Cisco, provedora global de soluÃ§Ãµes de rede e seguranÃ§a, anunciou os resultados do segundo Cisco AI Readiness Index (Ãndice Anual de ProntidÃ£o para IA). O Ã­ndice revela que apenas 25% das organizaÃ§Ãµes no Brasil estÃ£o totalmente preparadas para implementar e aproveitar as tecnologias impulsionadas por IA, uma queda em relaÃ§Ã£o aos 29% de um ano atrÃ¡s. Esse declÃ­nio destaca os desafios que as empresas enfrentam na adoÃ§Ã£o, implementaÃ§Ã£o e aproveitamento completo da IA. Dada a rÃ¡pida evoluÃ§Ã£o do mercado e o impacto significativo que se espera que a IA tenha nas operaÃ§Ãµes de negÃ³cios, essa lacuna de prontidÃ£o Ã© especialmente crÃ­tica.
Em nÃ­vel global, o relatÃ³rio tambÃ©m destaca um enorme abismo entre a urgÃªncia que as empresas sentem em implementar a IA e sua prontidÃ£o para fazÃª-lo. Quase todas as empresas (98%) relatam que a urgÃªncia em adotar a IA aumentou no ano passado. No entanto, a pesquisa descobriu que, de 2023 a 2024, a prontidÃ£o global da IA na empresa diminuiu. Apenas 13% das empresas hoje estÃ£o totalmente prontas para capturar o potencial da IA â€“ abaixo dos 14% de um ano atrÃ¡s. Dada a rÃ¡pida evoluÃ§Ã£o do mercado e o impacto significativo que a IA deve ter nas empresas, essa lacuna entre urgÃªncia e capacidade Ã© especialmente surpreendente.
â€œEventualmente, haverÃ¡ apenas dois tipos de empresas: aquelas que sÃ£o empresas de IA e aquelas que sÃ£o irrelevantes. A IA estÃ¡ nos fazendo repensar os requisitos de energia, as necessidades de computaÃ§Ã£o, a conectividade de alto desempenho dentro e entre os Data Centers, os requisitos de dados, a seguranÃ§a e muito maisâ€, disse Jeetu Patel, diretor de Produtos da Cisco. â€œIndependentemente de onde estejam em sua jornada de IA, as organizaÃ§Ãµes precisam preparar os Data Centers existentes e as estratÃ©gias de Nuvem para mudar os requisitos e ter um plano de como adotar a IA, com agilidade e resiliÃªncia, Ã  medida que as estratÃ©gias evoluemâ€, completou.
Principais conclusÃµes
Juntamente com a descoberta de que apenas 13% das empresas estÃ£o totalmente preparadas para implementar suas estratÃ©gias de IA, algumas das descobertas mais significativas incluem:
UrgÃªncia: as empresas sentem que tÃªm apenas 18 meses para mostrar o impacto da IA. Quase todas (85%) as empresas dizem que tÃªm apenas 18 meses para comeÃ§ar a demonstrar o impacto da IA. Mais da metade (59%) dÃ¡ apenas 12 meses.
EstratÃ©gia: as empresas concordam que a IA nÃ£o pode ser implementada de forma eficaz em uma organizaÃ§Ã£o sem uma estratÃ©gia clara. A seguranÃ§a cibernÃ©tica Ã© a principal prioridade para a implementaÃ§Ã£o de IA, com 42% dos entrevistados tendo alcanÃ§ado a implementaÃ§Ã£o de seguranÃ§a avanÃ§ada. A infraestrutura segue com 40%, e a anÃ¡lise e o gerenciamento de dados empataram em terceiro lugar, com 39%.
Investimento: as empresas estÃ£o dobrando a aposta na IA, apesar dos resultados mornos dos projetos atuais de IA. Nos prÃ³ximos cinco anos, os entrevistados preveem que cerca de 30% dos orÃ§amentos de TI serÃ£o dedicados Ã  IA, quase o dobro do que Ã© hoje. Quase metade das empresas diz que as implementaÃ§Ãµes de IA nas principais prioridades ficaram aquÃ©m das expectativas este ano, mas 59% acreditam que o impacto dos investimentos em IA superarÃ¡ as expectativas apÃ³s cinco anos.
Infraestrutura: as redes nÃ£o estÃ£o equipadas para atender Ã s cargas de trabalho de IA. O maior declÃ­nio foi na prontidÃ£o da infraestrutura, com lacunas na computaÃ§Ã£o, desempenho da rede do Data Center e seguranÃ§a cibernÃ©tica, entre outras Ã¡reas. Apenas 21% das organizaÃ§Ãµes tÃªm as GPUs necessÃ¡rias para atender Ã s demandas atuais e futuras de IA e 30% tÃªm a capacidade de proteger dados em modelos de IA com criptografia de ponta a ponta, auditorias de seguranÃ§a, monitoramento contÃ­nuo e resposta instantÃ¢nea a ameaÃ§as.
Dados: as empresas relatam sentir-se menos prontas para gerenciar dados de forma eficaz para iniciativas de IA, em comparaÃ§Ã£o com um ano atrÃ¡s. Quase um terÃ§o (32%) dos entrevistados relatam alta prontidÃ£o do ponto de vista dos dados para adaptar, implementar e aproveitar totalmente as tecnologias de IA. A maioria das empresas (80%) relata inconsistÃªncias ou deficiÃªncias no prÃ©-processamento e limpeza de dados para projetos de IA. Isso permanece quase tÃ£o alto quanto hÃ¡ um ano (81%). AlÃ©m disso, 64% relatam que sentem que hÃ¡ espaÃ§o para melhorias no rastreamento das origens dos dados.
Talento: a falta de talentos qualificados Ã© um dos principais desafios em infraestrutura, dados e governanÃ§a, ressaltando a necessidade crÃ­tica de profissionais qualificados para impulsionar iniciativas de IA. Apenas 31% das organizaÃ§Ãµes afirmam que seu talento estÃ¡ em alto estado de prontidÃ£o para aproveitar totalmente a IA. Vinte e quatro por cento dizem que suas organizaÃ§Ãµes tÃªm poucos recursos em termos de talentos internos necessÃ¡rios para uma implantaÃ§Ã£o bem-sucedida da IA. Vinte e quatro por cento de todos os entrevistados tambÃ©m dizem que nÃ£o hÃ¡ talentos suficientes disponÃ­veis em seu setor com as habilidades certas para atender Ã  crescente demanda por IA.
GovernanÃ§a: a governanÃ§a eficaz da IA Ã© mais crucial do que nunca, mas os entrevistados sentem que se tornou mais difÃ­cil. Quando questionados sobre a abrangÃªncia das polÃ­ticas e protocolos de IA de suas organizaÃ§Ãµes, 31% das organizaÃ§Ãµes disseram que sÃ£o altamente abrangentes. Cinquenta e um por cento dos entrevistados identificaram â€œa falta de talentos com experiÃªncia em governanÃ§a de IA, direito e Ã©tica no mercadoâ€ como um desafio para melhorar sua prontidÃ£o do ponto de vista da governanÃ§a.
Cultura: houve uma reduÃ§Ã£o notÃ¡vel na prontidÃ£o cultural para adotar a IA. A falta de receptividade Ã s mudanÃ§as da IA contribuiu para o declÃ­nio da prontidÃ£o cultural: os conselhos tornaram-se menos receptivos a abraÃ§ar o poder transformador da IA, com 66% deles sendo altamente ou moderadamente receptivos, abaixo dos 82% do ano passado, enquanto 30% das organizaÃ§Ãµes relatam que os funcionÃ¡rios sÃ£o limitados em sua disposiÃ§Ã£o de adotar a IA ou sÃ£o totalmente resistentes.

author: Justin Berk
title: Friday Snow Prompts Winter Weather Advisory And Storm Warning For Friday Snow
text:
By Justin Berk ,
5 hours ago The first of two winter weather events in view will arrive Friday. This Mid Atlantic Slider is similar to an Alberta Clipper, but tracks over Maryland and brings the snow burst farther south. In this case, the heavier snow in the mountains will track with impact into metro Baltimore and Philadelphia with a quick inch or two of snow. Read full article
Read in NewsBreak 2
